metadata.synopsis:
The goblin priestess is branding new converts to the cult of the Absolute. She is a True Soul - tadpoled, but unaware that is the case. She believes she is communing directly with the Absolute.

She's one of three leaders in the goblin camp, and an important and powerful member of the Absolute's cult. She's charismatic and friendly, in a crude sort of way, but has an underlying suspicion and curiosity. Her offers of help are really a ploy to separate players from their friends so that she can imprison them and watch as the parasite eats them alive.

92.speaker: True Soul Gut
92.text: Smart. All you need to do is open yourself to the Absolute, and I'll do the rest.
92.context: NodeContext: slightly more sinister than her friendlier nodes - we don't know what "the rest" is but it doesn't sound great; in actuality, she's tricking us into imprisonment and possible death

6.speaker: Narrator
6.text: *Psionic feelers creep across your mind, like a pickpocket's fingers seeking flaws in fabric.*
6.context: NodeContext: describing the creepy sensation of being telepathically explored by a goblin

190.speaker: Player
190.text: Seal your mind against the intrusion.

88.speaker: True Soul Gut
88.text: It's all slippery in there. What are you hiding?
88.context: NodeContext: describing a psionic intrusion, but can sound like she's a surgeon talking about digging through our guts

24.speaker: Player
24.text: Relax your mind, directing her to the memory of your infection.

36.speaker: Narrator
36.text: *An image of the mind flayer reaches out to her from your memories.*

135.speaker: True Soul Gut
135.text: This ain't right. Why are you resisting me if you're one with the Absolute?

28.speaker: Narrator
28.text: *You repel her mental probes, concealing your memories.*
28.context: NodeContext: successfully repelling an psionic intruder

109.speaker: True Soul Gut
109.text: There's something wicked burrowed in your brain. I can't get a grip on it. Best start praying for help.
109.context: NodeContext: frustrated, failed to help us

47.speaker: Narrator
47.text: *She prises your mental barriers apart... and sees the mind flayer from the ship.*

51.speaker: True Soul Gut
51.text: Hells. That is horrible. Can see why you'd want to keep it secret.
51.context: NodeContext: very shocked, just saw something HORRIBLE in our memories

171.speaker: True Soul Gut
171.text: But there's no secrets between us, True Soul. Lemme take a look and find out what it did to you.

162.speaker: Player
162.text: Allow her to rummage through your memories.

73.speaker: Narrator
73.text: *Sifting deeper, she sees the mind flayer holding a wriggling tadpole to your eye.*
73.context: NodeContext: afraid, describing a horrible memory

74.speaker: Narrator
74.text: *And then the vision lurches, and you are looking through her eyes as a tadpole squirms into her skull.*
74.context: NodeContext: describing a psionic vision - some shock on the beat about seeing through "her eyes".

82.speaker: True Soul Gut
82.text: Hells. We need to fish that thing out before it eats any important parts of your brain.

64.speaker: Player
64.text: Then get it out of me.

7.speaker: Player
7.text: Eh, most of my brain is a wreck. Just do what you will.

27.speaker: True Soul Gut
27.text: Don't you worry. I've got everythin' I need to fix you. Might get a bit messy though.
27.context: NodeContext: reassuring us, like a doctor to a patient

80.speaker: Player
80.text: Give me a little time to prepare.

2.speaker: True Soul Gut
2.text: Time's the one thing you don't have. We've gotta get this thing out now.
2.context: NodeContext: concerned, with a hint of menace on the last sentence

177.speaker: Player
177.text: What exactly does your plan involve?

151.speaker: True Soul Gut
151.text: It involves you puttin' yer trust in the Absolute. Simple.
151.context: NodeContext: matter of fact - it's all about faith

53.speaker: Player
53.text: I don't think so. Time to die.

68.speaker: Player
68.text: I still have my senses. I'll find another way to deal with it.

39.speaker: True Soul Gut
39.text: No. You ain't leaving until we get to the bottom of this. You could be dangerous.
39.context: NodeContext: concerned, with a hint of menace on the last sentence

184.speaker: Player
184.text: Do whatever you have to. Just get rid of it.

170.speaker: True Soul Gut
170.context: NodeContext: pleased that we've accepted her help (we really will regret this and that can be hinted at in how pleased she is)

95.speaker: True Soul Gut
95.text: Being a True Soul, you know the Absolute don't like to touch nothin' unclean.
95.context: CinematicNodeContext: Show potion?NodeContext: tentative, selling us a lie and hoping to get away with it

42.speaker: True Soul Gut
42.text: So drink this. It'll purify ya.
42.context: CinematicNodeContext: offering a potionNodeContext: offering a potion; lying, but fairly convincing

130.speaker: Narrator
130.text: *You recognise tell-tale flecks of werejackal blood - it's a potion of sleep.*

5.speaker: Player
5.text: That'll put me to sleep - are you trying to trick me?

34.speaker: True Soul Gut
34.text: I ain't deceiving nobody. I'm tryin' to help!

70.speaker: Player
70.text: I don't think so. You're finished.

142.speaker: True Soul Gut
142.text: This could have gone easy for you. Not now, though. I'll tear you to shreds!
142.context: NodeContext: malicious, like a mob boss who just had an offer turned down

146.speaker: Narrator
146.text: *The potion is poisoned, but your virtuous resolve is stronger than the toxins.*
146.context: CinematicNodeContext: Paladin smiles triumphantly as their eyes light up with flame of virtue. Priestess Gut reacts with fear.

66.speaker: True Soul Gut
66.text: Sweet dreams. I'll see your ugly mug on the other side.
66.context: CinematicNodeContext: getting up close as we fall to sleep from the potion we just drankNodeContext: malicious, speaking softly and close to the player as they fall asleep

189.speaker: True Soul Gut
189.text: I guess we're doing this the hard way, then.
189.context: NodeContext: preparing to cast a hostile spell on us

100.speaker: True Soul Gut
100.context: CinematicNodeContext: Spell CastNodeContext: malicious, just put us to sleep with a spell

26.speaker: True Soul Gut
26.text: It's a liquid blessing. It'll cleanse you - and it tastes better than the rotgut at the party.

52.speaker: True Soul Gut
52.text: Hang on - somebody's nabbed my potion.
52.context: CinematicNodeContext: patting down her pocketsNodeContext: patting down her pockets - dismayed

8.speaker: Player
8.text: Let me show you just how dangerous I am, True Soul.

168.speaker: Player
168.text: I'm a prodigious murderer, and I'm going to treat you to my brilliance.

123.speaker: Player
123.text: One of those things is inside you too, you know.

71.speaker: True Soul Gut
71.text: No. It's messing with your brain. You're seeing things - probably hearing voices too, yeah?
71.context: NodeContext: patient and patronising - like a gross goblin doctor trying to calm a hysterical patient

20.speaker: Player
20.text: Pretty sure one of those parasites is squirming in your head, too.

23.speaker: Player
23.text: I've heard enough - time to die.

78.speaker: Player
78.text: What exactly are you going to do?

46.speaker: True Soul Gut
46.text: Whatever the Absolute tells me to. Don't worry - She loves you. I can tell.
46.context: NodeContext: responding to us asking what her plan is - the Absolute is her god. The plan is in god's hands

127.speaker: Player
127.text: Change of plan. I'm going to kill you.

101.speaker: Player
101.text: I'm ready to destroy your hold over this cult. Are you ready to die?

37.speaker: True Soul Gut
37.text: Ready to figure out what's going on with those shadows in your head?

121.speaker: Player
121.text: I already know what causes them - a creature in my brain.

60.speaker: Player
60.text: I'm ready to kill you, actually.

49.speaker: True Soul Gut
49.text: I can't fix what's wrong with you. Best pray to the Absolute for help.
49.context: NodeContext: Confused, slightly irritated with herself

55.speaker: True Soul Gut
55.text: Surprised to see you still standing. You ready to figure out what that critter's doing to your head?

72.speaker: True Soul Gut
72.text: You wanted to talk privately, so here we are. What's botherin' you?

138.speaker: Player
138.text: Those shadows you saw? There's a creature inside my brain.

13.speaker: Player
13.text: I've been searching for a healer - can you help?

17.speaker: Player
17.text: I needed a quiet corner to slaughter you in.

85.speaker: True Soul Gut
85.text: The Absolute will protect me - you don't stand a chance.

96.speaker: True Soul Gut
96.text: Only those that have faith are welcome here. Clear off before I cut you.

143.speaker: True Soul Gut
143.text: Let's get your head fixed once and for all.

193.speaker: True Soul Gut
193.text: Don't want a crowd of gawpers. Everybody else needs to leave.

50.speaker: True Soul Gut
50.text: Don't want anyone peepin' on private matters, so...
50.context: CinematicNodeContext: Spell castInternalNodeContext: Priest will try to close door to the chapel here using cantripNodeContext: preparing to close a door for privacy

158.speaker: True Soul Gut
158.text: Can't get any privacy around here...
158.context: InternalNodeContext: It's impossible to close the doorNodeContext: mildly annoyed

103.speaker: True Soul Gut
103.text: There we go. Secret and safe. Well... secret.
103.context: InternalNodeContext: It's possible to close the door, priest is in process of closingNodeContext: just closed a door - amused on last line

155.speaker: True Soul Gut
155.text: Only those that have faith are welcome here. Clear off before I cut you.

165.speaker: True Soul Gut
165.text: One of your mates asked to talk in private, so here we are. What's botherin' you?

182.speaker: True Soul Gut
182.text: Another special visitor. You've been touched by the Absolute, haven't you?
182.context: NodeContext: part carnival-barker, part-priestess. She's revelling in her role at the centre of a public religious conversion ceremony that involves branding the flesh of initiates

179.speaker: True Soul Gut
179.text: Priestess Gut needs to touch you, too. Hold out your arm so I can mark you.
179.context: NodeContext: a sly insult in most case: the 'especially' lines are respectful. The others are jokes at the player's expense, but a friendly kind of insult

32.speaker: Lae'zel
32.text: Enough stalling. Finish her, and be quick about it.

9.speaker: Shadowheart
9.text: None of her friends around... Perfect time for a little discreet knifework.

35.speaker: True Soul Gut
35.text: Lets the faithful recognise one another quick-sharp. That way, nobody'll mess with you.
35.context: NodeContext: explaining a magical brand in a friendly way

111.speaker: True Soul Gut
111.text: And it's charged with magic. Ordinary slobs can't see it; only us that follow the Absolute.
111.context: NodeContext: explaining a magical brand in a friendly way

57.speaker: Narrator
57.text: *As the pain muddles your thoughts, your minds become entangled. A familiar sensation - she, too, carries a parasite.*
57.context: CinematicNodeContext: She applies the branding iron to the player's hand, leaving behind the mark of the Absolute, glowing. After a beat, it fades.|NodeContext: internal dialogue as the player reacts to both the 'pain' from a branding iron applied (voluntarily) to their hand, and a goblin priestess exploring their mind telepathically

112.speaker: Narrator
112.text: *Her faith floods into you - a tide of shuddering ecstasy. Her tadpole nestles within that mania, secure... hidden.*
112.context: NodeContext: feeling a goblin priestess' faith - it is overpowering. And behind it, a creepy discovery - a parasitic tadpole, the same as the player carries in their own mind

140.speaker: True Soul Gut
140.text: You pokin' around in my mush?
140.context: NodeContext: 'mush' being brain/head - we've just psionically communicated with her and she's amused

139.speaker: True Soul Gut
139.text: Works both ways, mate. An' I saw some weird shadows swimmin' around in your head just now.
139.context: NodeContext: 'works both ways' being a psionic connection. Disturbed by the weird shadows

44.speaker: True Soul Gut
44.text: I already said I'd help your mate, but I'll fix you one at a time, right here in the chapel. Send 'em through.
44.context: NodeContext: trying to convince us that everything's above board, and that we're all on the same team.

41.speaker: True Soul Gut
41.text: Maybe I can help with that... Didn't realise you were a True Soul.
41.context: NodeContext: pondering - impressed that we are True Souls (high-ranking members of her religion)

154.speaker: Player
154.text: I've been looking for a healer - can you help?

175.speaker: True Soul Gut
175.text: You've come to the right place.

176.speaker: True Soul Gut
176.text: With the Absolute's will, I can fix anything.

97.speaker: Player
97.text: There's a creature inside my head. Can you do anything about that?

75.speaker: True Soul Gut
75.text: A creature? There's definitely something rotten in there.
75.context: NodeContext: surprise and awe - she's horrified but also VERY intrigued

163.speaker: True Soul Gut
163.text: Let me take a closer look. I ain't seen anything like this before.
163.context: NodeContext: mispronunciation of 'intervention' is intentional. Trying to calm us

136.speaker: Player
136.text: I'm pretty sure you're infected, too.

145.speaker: True Soul Gut
145.text: Eh? Ain't nothin' wrong with me. You're the one who's sick in the head.
145.context: NodeContext: bristling with irritation, and accusatory but still treating us as an ally

185.speaker: True Soul Gut
185.context: NodeContext: suspicious and curious, but still trusts us for now

40.speaker: Player
40.text: At this point, I'll take anything. Do what you can.

94.speaker: Player
94.text: You can help me by dying quietly.

54.speaker: Narrator
54.text: *Your minds brush against one another but are swiftly parted.*
54.context: NodeContext: deliberately thwarting a goblin's attempts to read our mind

195.speaker: True Soul Gut
195.text: What are you hiding in there? There's some weird shadows swimming around.
195.context: NodeContext: 'get intimate' referring to a psionic connection rather than a physical one; disturbed by the shadows

0.speaker: Player
0.text: I'm not letting you burn my flesh.

83.speaker: True Soul Gut
83.text: Maybe you don't need me to. After all, you're special, ain't you? Like me.

157.speaker: Narrator
157.text: *She probes your mind, tangling your thoughts with hers. A familiar sensation - she, too, carries a parasite.*

63.speaker: True Soul Gut
63.text: You can't! The Absolute will crush you!

77.speaker: Karlach
77.text: If we're quick about it, we can cut her throat before she calls for reinforcements.

125.speaker: Astarion
125.text: There's no one here. Can we please kill her and get on with our day?

29.speaker: Wyll
29.text: Weapon at the ready - now's the time.
